newsitem.title: CHINA: Yuan closes down against US dollar in Shanghai.
newsitem.headline: Yuan closes down against US dollar in Shanghai.

text.p: The Chinese yuan closed down on a technical correction that began on Tuesday, at 8.3072 against the U.S. dollar on Wednesday, from Tuesday's 8.3065, on the Shanghai-based interbank foreign exchange market.
The yuan opened slightly up at an intra-day high of 8.3063 and fell to move in a narrow range around 8.3070 for most of the session, hitting an intraday low of 8.3074 late in the session.
Trading was active, with most done at 8.3070, traders said.
Dealers said the yuan's uptrend was capped below 8.3050 over the past two days, after rising sharply in the past month.
"Pro-yuan sentiment was weakened by intervention at 8.3050 by the People's Bank of China," one dealer said. "But demand for yuan remained strong."
Dealers expect the yuan to move in a range of 8.3060 to 8.3070 on Thursday.
The yuan closed up at 7.6552 from 7.6804 against 100 Japanese yen, and up slightly at 1.0735 from 1.0740 against the Hong Kong dollar.
